ErickM, actualy, no ideas on that. Try disabling some 'agressive' plugins. Setting CPU frequency to 333. Also can suggest updating your FW, but it's up to you, and no guarantee it'll help. On the other hand - original source states that game must be playable on M33-6 and higher. Also using prometheus helped some ppl, but this image is already imbued with prometheus, so i dunno if this realy makes sense. Also, you can try to press Cross two times when you hear music started in menu. This will give you normal difficulty new game.

drdre74, i had problems like this and they were caused by non-original fucked-up Memory Stick. Cutscene image shatters and the console even switches off. Fortunately, i had another one - original card from Sony, so i've put game on it and it works like a charm. Not sure that this is your case, so you can also try to set your CPU frequency to 333, maybe it'll help.
Good luck, mates.

Following shoutout goes to everyone having issues with this game!
Universal trouble-shooting guide:
1. If game does not launch, disable all you plugins, experiment with different 'UMD ISO Modes", or/and "CPU CLOCK GAME" settings.
2. If game launches for you, but works poorly (low framerate, lagging videos) try setting your "CPU CLOCK GAME" to "333/166" - it surely drains battery faster, but it helped alot of ppl, including me.

Here is an example screeny for you: http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/9198/20101105125430.png - to get to VSH menu like this just press SELECT button while in XMB.

@reborn10 & NeosMX:

To change the clock setting of your PSP just press the "SELECT" button and the VSH Menu will appear.
1. On CPU CLOCK XMB change the setting to 333/166 by pressing the left or right arrow key.

2. On CPU CLOCK GAME change the setting to 333/166 by pressing the left or right arrow key.

3. Now scroll down to EXIT and restart your PSP and try the game.

Now, if you can not enter to VSH menu even though you try pressing the SELECT button many times. You have another option to change the clock setting. You need to go to the Recovery Menu. In getting to Recovery Menu follow the instruction below:

1. Turn off your PSP first. It's much better you remove the battery and put it again to be sure that your PSP is in cold boot process.
2. Then press & hold the R Shoulder button while sliding the power switch to ON.
3. Now the Recovery Menu will appear. Scroll down to the CPU Speed by pressing the down arrow key and then press the X button to enter.
4. There you can see the "Speed in XMB" is set in default so change it by pressing the X button until you reach 333.
5. Same also in the "Speed in UMD/ISO" change it to 333.
6. Now go back to the Main Menu and scroll down to EXIT. Your PSP will automatically restart and try now the game.

Now, if the problem still exist, there is nothing much I can do to help you. 

You may try the trial and error procedure by inserting your memory stick with this game to one of your friend's PSP who has a CFW and compare the result. You may borrow the memory stick of your friend and try it to your PSP and see if it works.

That's all I can advice, and good luck...peace...

By the way, I forgot to tell you how to disable the plugins.

1. Turn off your PSP.
2. Press and hold the R Shoulder Button while turning ON your PSP.
3. Revovery menu will appear in your screen. Scroll down to Plugins by pressing the down arrow key and press X to enter.
4. Now you can see all you plug-ins. Now set them all to "Disable" mode.
5. Go back to main menu and exit the recovery menu.
6. Try now the game if it works.

Hope this would help you.
